snippet: Businesses that I.B.M. has earmarked for growth performed robustly, but that was not enough to offset weak demand elsewhere.
abstract: IBM reports first-quarter net income of $3 billion, down 1 percent from same period a year earlier; revenue is down 5 percent from year-ago period, to $23.4 billion, falling short of analyst expectations and underscoring falloff in hardware business amid economic uncertainty.
lead_paragraph: Businesses that I.B.M. has earmarked for growth performed robustly, but that was not enough to offset weak demand elsewhere.

headline.seo: I.B.M. Shares Fall After Earnings Miss Estimates
headline.main: I.B.M., Missing Estimates, Falters as Slow Hardware Sales Hurt Revenue and Profits
headline.print_headline: I.B.M., Missing Estimates, Falters as Slow Hardware Sales Hurt Revenue and Profits
